meanings.definition: Persuading or leading someone to do something by deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She inveigled her friend into sharing her toys by complimenting her.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tried to inveigle customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inveigled the dog into chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks inveigled the audience into believing in magic.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of freshly baked cookies inveigled the children into the kitchen.

meanings.definition: The act of enticing or luring someone into doing something.
meanings.sent1: His smile was an inveiglement that drew people towards him.
meanings.sent2: The inveiglement of the treasure map led the adventurers into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent3: The promise of free samples was an inveiglement to get people to visit the new store.
meanings.sent4: The inveiglement of fame can sometimes lead individuals down a treacherous path.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling lights of the city were an inveiglement for the country girl to explore.
